book_name: CAE Oxford Human Performance and Limitations

questions.question: A pilot is reading a checklist. In what way is this reference to the SHELL Concept ?
What percentage of the appropriate population are anthropometric data table measurements taken from?
options: a. 80%, i.e. the tenth to the ninetieth percentile, using contour, dynamic and static data
b. 90%, i.e. the fifth to the ninety-fifth percentile, using contour, dynamic and static data
c. 50%, i.e. the twenty-fifth to the seventy-fifth percentile, using contour, dynamic and static data

questions.question: What is the most common checklist error?
options: b. Too many capital letters are used

questions.question: What is the purpose of the lumbar support?
options: a. To allow the most comfortable position for the spine and higher neck bones
b. To allow the most comfortable position for the spine and shoulder bones
c. To allow the most comfortable position for the spine
d. To produce an even pressure of the discs by allowing the lower spine to curve naturally

questions.question: What are the essential characteristics of a cockpit warning?
options: a. It should have the best attention-getting qualities as possible
b. It should be attention-getting but not alarming
c. It should have attention-getting qualities which do not compromise a clear indiction to the pilot of the faulty component/system
d. Must not dazzle or possibly compromise the crew's night vision

questions.question: What is the most important feature of flight deck design?
options: a. Escape and emergency exits should be clear of obstructions
b. The design eye point must be clearly marked
c. Important controls must be located in easily reached and unobstructed positions
d. Controls and indicators should be standardized

questions.question: What will the pilot lose sight of on the approach if seated below the Design Eye Point?
options: c. Peripheral objects especially at night

questions.question: What instrument is best for showing small change?
What colour should the 'Alert' warning be on a CRT?
Which pitot/static instrument is most likely to be misread?
options: a. The ASI at night illuminated by a red light
b. The ASI at night illuminated by low intensity white light

questions.question: A manually operated valve should be opened by:
options: d. depends on the system it operates

questions.question: The three types of anthropometric measurements are:
In the Shell Model L stands for:
System Tolerance can be subdivided into:
A flashing red warning light on a CRT normally indicates:
options: a. there is a fault in a critical system

questions.question: Automation Complacency is:
options: a. overconfidence in the handling capability of the pilot
b. overconfidence in the handling capability of the pilot of computers
d. the blind belief in automation

questions.question: Mode error is associated with:
A danger of automation is that:
options: a. there can be greater delays between the performance of the crew and its ultimate effect
b. delays between the performance of the crew and its ultimate effect are shortened
c. delays between the performance of the crew and its ultimate effect are not appreciated
d. delays between the performance of the crew and its ultimate effect have no effect

questions.question: Automation:
options: a. helps with unusual and unexpected situations
b. may result in a pilot being unaware of important information when dealing with an unusual and unexpected situation
c. increases reaction time when dealing with unusual and unexpected situations
d. decreases reaction time when dealing with unusual and unexpected situations

questions.question: Automation can result in:
options: a. lack of information being passed between crew members
b. too much information being passed between crew members
c. confused information being passed between crew members
d. too much detailed information being passed between crew members
